title: If you're ready to transform, ask yourself these 9 life-changing questions
text:
Ayodeji Awosika is an author, personal development blogger, and wannabe philosopher. His purpose in life is helping other people break free from the chains of their circumstances and live the lives they're destined for.

If you feel stagnant in your life, or realize that you're not where you want to be, it's easy to feel stuck in your circumstances.

If you're ready to try something different, it's time to ask yourself some questions. How does your career factor into how you're feeling? How would you ideally be living?

Start with a small first step — even something like committing to keeping your room clean is a fair start.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

You blink and all the sudden your life isn't quite where you want it to be.

You live your life day to day. Your days are more or less the same. It's not like you wake up and terrible things happen (although sometimes you do). You have slight annoyances, little moments where you sigh, and periods of daydreaming about a better future.

"No big deal," you tell yourself. After all, you have plenty of life to live, right? You can always change your situation. Over time, though, you're overcome by the feeling of being stuck.

Ayodeji Awosika. Courtesy of Ayodeji Awosika

What makes being stuck so difficult to deal with? You didn't get stuck all at once. It happened slowly and subtly. You can't pinpoint one moment or one day where your life started to go in a direction you didn't want it to go in. It sort of, just, happened.

Now you're here. More or less, you have two options for your future. Stay the same or try something different. If you opt for the latter, you can ask yourself great questions to find out what you can do next.

This is just a blog post. Your life isn't going to magically change after reading it, but it's a good start. Although the post itself might be trivial, the consequences of your action or inaction are definitely not.

This is your life.

Genuinely ask yourself these questions and see where the answers take you.
description: If you feel stuck in your circumstances, it's up to you to make the choice to change. Start with these questions.
